meanings.sent1: We had a lot of craic at the party last night.
meanings.sent2: The craic at the carnival was infectious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter filled the park, creating a craic-filled atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her jokes were the craic that lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The craic of the music festival lingered in the air long after it ended.

meanings.definition: Good times or socializing with others.
meanings.sent1: Joining in the craic with friends always lifts my spirits.
meanings.sent2: The pub was full of lively craic on Friday evenings.
meanings.sent3: The craic of the family reunion brought everyone closer together.
meanings.sent4: Their shared craic was the glue that bonded the group.
meanings.sent5: The craic of the picnic made it a day to remember.
